gw.api.web.util

Class PCCurrencyAmountUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.web.util.PCCurrencyAmountUtil

  • public class PCCurrencyAmountUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    MonetaryAmount utility methods for PolicyCenter.
    Author:
    bhsu

      in 9.0.3. Use CurrencyUtil.getRoundingMode()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static MonetaryAmount calculatePercentage(MonetaryAmount value, java.math.BigDecimal percentage) 
      static MonetaryAmount calculatePercentage(MonetaryAmount value, java.math.BigDecimal percentage, java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode) 
      static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion, MonetaryAmount total) 
      static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion, MonetaryAmount total, int scale)
      Deprecated. 
      in 9.0.3. Usage of method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount) is preferable to have the same scale of calculation percentages across PC. Usage of this method causes losing precision when result of percentage calculation is applied to amount, e.g.: 
       

 MonetaryAmount total = new MonetaryAmount("12226.01 USD");
 MonetaryAmount portion = new MonetaryAmount("555.55 USD");
 BigDecimal percentage = calculatePercentageOf(portion, total, portion.getAmount().scale());
 // percentage is 4.54, but should be 4.544..
 // apply it to some amount
 MonetaryAmount amount = calculatePercentage(new MonetaryAmount("321654 USD"), percentage);
 // result is 14603.09 usd but should be 14615.96 usd
      Result is really dependent to calculated amounts and might have a big impact for calculation. Method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount) will calculate percentage with scale 6.
      static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion, MonetaryAmount total, int scale, java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Deprecated. 
      in 9.0.3. Usage of method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount, RoundingMode) is preferable to have the same scale of calculation percentages across PC. Usage of this method causes losing precision when result of percentage calculation is applied to amount, e.g.: 
       

 MonetaryAmount total = new MonetaryAmount("12226.01 USD");
 MonetaryAmount portion = new MonetaryAmount("555.55 USD");
 BigDecimal percentage = calculatePercentageOf(portion, total, portion.getAmount().scale(), RoundingMode.HALF_UP);
 // percentage is 4.54, but should be 4.544..
 // apply it to some amount
 MonetaryAmount amount = calculatePercentage(new MonetaryAmount("321654 USD"), percentage);
 // result is 14603.09 usd but should be 14615.96 usd
      Result is really dependent to calculated amounts and might have a big impact for calculation. Method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount, RoundingMode) will calculate percentage with scale 6.
      static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion, MonetaryAmount total, java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode) 
      static MonetaryAmount max(MonetaryAmount value1, MonetaryAmount value2) 
      static MonetaryAmount min(MonetaryAmount value1, MonetaryAmount value2)

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePercentage

        public static MonetaryAmount calculatePercentage(MonetaryAmount value,
                                                 java.math.BigDecimal percentage)

      • calculatePercentageOf

        @Deprecated
public static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion,
                                                                     MonetaryAmount total,
                                                                     int scale)
        Deprecated. in 9.0.3. Usage of method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount) is preferable to have the same scale of calculation percentages across PC. Usage of this method causes losing precision when result of percentage calculation is applied to amount, e.g.: 
         

 MonetaryAmount total = new MonetaryAmount("12226.01 USD");
 MonetaryAmount portion = new MonetaryAmount("555.55 USD");
 BigDecimal percentage = calculatePercentageOf(portion, total, portion.getAmount().scale());
 // percentage is 4.54, but should be 4.544..
 // apply it to some amount
 MonetaryAmount amount = calculatePercentage(new MonetaryAmount("321654 USD"), percentage);
 // result is 14603.09 usd but should be 14615.96 usd
        Result is really dependent to calculated amounts and might have a big impact for calculation. Method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount) will calculate percentage with scale 6.

      • calculatePercentageOf

        public static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion,
                                                         MonetaryAmount total)

      • calculatePercentage

        public static MonetaryAmount calculatePercentage(MonetaryAmount value,
                                                 java.math.BigDecimal percentage,
                                                 java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)

      • calculatePercentageOf

        @Deprecated
public static java.math.BigDecimal calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount portion,
                                                                     MonetaryAmount total,
                                                                     int scale,
                                                                     java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Deprecated. in 9.0.3. Usage of method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount, RoundingMode) is preferable to have the same scale of calculation percentages across PC. Usage of this method causes losing precision when result of percentage calculation is applied to amount, e.g.: 
         

 MonetaryAmount total = new MonetaryAmount("12226.01 USD");
 MonetaryAmount portion = new MonetaryAmount("555.55 USD");
 BigDecimal percentage = calculatePercentageOf(portion, total, portion.getAmount().scale(), RoundingMode.HALF_UP);
 // percentage is 4.54, but should be 4.544..
 // apply it to some amount
 MonetaryAmount amount = calculatePercentage(new MonetaryAmount("321654 USD"), percentage);
 // result is 14603.09 usd but should be 14615.96 usd
        Result is really dependent to calculated amounts and might have a big impact for calculation. Method calculatePercentageOf(MonetaryAmount, MonetaryAmount, RoundingMode) will calculate percentage with scale 6.

      • calculatePercentageOf

                                                         MonetaryAmount total,
                                                         java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
